document.title: Navigating and Browsing Code
document.paragraph:
Most of Visual Studio .NET language packages provide facilities to browse component references and code written in the language; EiffelEnvision is no exception. EiffelEnvision plugs directly into Visual Studio .NET's code browsing facilities and even extends the stock behavior to enhance code navigation. This section of the documentation provides the information on the extension and facilities exploited by EiffelEnvision.
in_this_section2In This Sectionclass_view/index.xmlClass View EiffelEnvision plugs into and extends the Class View in Visual Studio .NET to enhance the default code browsing facilities offered by Visual Studio .NET. object_browser/index.xmlObject Browser EiffelEnvision also plugs into the Object Browser in Visual Studio .NET. EiffelEnvision brings with it the additions required to facilitate ../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xmlEiffel for .NET developers with the tools they may need. icon_glossary.xmlClass View and Object Browser Icons An icon glossary for the icons used in the EiffelEnvision specific sections of both the Class View and Object Browser. also_see2Related SectionsSee Also:ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxoribrowsingcodecomponents.htmBrowsing Code and Componentsms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfclassviewwindow.htmVisual Studio .NET Class Viewms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmVisual Studio .NET Object Browser../eiffel_editor/index.xmlEiffel Editor
